briefTitle: An Efficacy Study of GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) Biologicals' Candidate Influenza Vaccine GSK2321138A in Children
officialTitle: An Efficacy Study of GSK Biologicals' Quadrivalent Influenza Vaccine GSK2321138A (FLU D-QIV) When Administered in Children

interventions.name: Quadrivalent seasonal influenza vaccine(Flu D-QIV) GSK2321138A

summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy, immunogenicity and safety of GSK Biologicals' influenza candidate vaccine GSK2321138A when compared to non-influenza vaccine comparators in children 6 to 35 months of age. Recruitment will encompass at least 4 independent cohorts: a first cohort in the Northern Hemisphere (2011-2012), a second cohort in subtropical countries (2012), third cohort in the Northern Hemisphere (2012-2013) and a fourth cohort and additional independent cohorts possibly in NH countries (end 2013) and subtropical countries (beginning 2014).

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Moderate to Severe RT-PCR Confirmed Influenza.
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: During the surveillance period (approximately 6 to 8 months)
